intro: Berkheya gorterioides, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange ray florets and dark brown disk florets. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a compact, bushy habit with linear to lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, showy flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Berkheya gorterioides is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant color and drought tolerance.
